e4: Switching to an unbiased earnings policy enhances transparency, ensuring that all investors, including less sophisticated ones, access genuine performance metrics. This proactive approach minimizes the risk of potential legal challenges and maintains integrity in financial reporting, ultimately reinforcing investor confidence and aligning with ethical business practices foundationally.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and impartial presentation of information. It should prevent bias and ensure accessibility of complete insights fortifying clarity for both sophisticated analysts and average investors.
